"Wow," Anna said looking stunned, "I don't know if that was romantic or stupid."

"Me either."

"My poor baby." Cindy said with tears in her eyes as she went for another hug.

"Mom, I'm ok. Really." Michael said returning the hug tenuously while trying to back out of it.

"You go shower up and take a nap. You're still reek of sweat from earlier. Don't worry about the food, I'll take care of the rest. Anna, here's $50, go out and get a bottle of wine and batch of cookies to go with the roast for Tiffany."

"Mom you don't have to do..." Michael tried to say.

"Nonsense, now please let me be the dotting mom again just for the night. Go clean up and relax, you've had a trying day."

With that Michael left to head up to his bathroom for a shower, but before he entered he was stopped by Anna who jokingly said, "I don't see why I have to get a batch of cookies, I mean you already gave Tiffany his desert."

"I told you we just had one kiss." Michael snapped at Anna.

"Calm down, it's a joke. The kiss was all I was referring to. You don't have to bite my head off."

"Oh," Michael said sheepishly, "Sorry."

"It's ok, I probably took it too far. Just...be ok. Alright sis."

"Sure thing," and once again the 'sisters' shared an embrace.

With that Michael went into the bathroom, something dawned on him that he didn't really have time to dwell on considering what had happened.

I kissed Tiffany? Michael suddenly thought to himself as if it was the first he'd heard of this. Well, it was just a friendly little quick kiss to show my gratitude. Michael looked in the mirror and saw that even his reflection wasn't believing what he'd just thought. Well, at least it didn't mean anything. His buxom and beautiful reflection still didn't seem to buy it. Well, at least I know I won't do it again. After all, I love Josie and not Tiffany, right? Michael's reflection had changed this time, but instead of showing a man confident in what he'd thought, he just saw a confused woman who wasn't sure if what was just thought was true.

"Tomorrow is going to be an interesting day." Michael told his reflection before stripping down for a much needed shower.
1323311111112121111211112121121111111111.title: At home with Anna and Cindy

choices: "It doesn't have to be that way."
"You're right, we have lives we need to get back to."
1323311111112121111211112121121111111111.content:
Tuesday morning Michael woke up for the first time in a while completely unsure of what he wanted to do. After his crisis of self last night he went down and tried to put the finishing touches on the roast and stew but his mom would have no part of that and shooed him back upstairs to rest after the days events. Michael spent hours wondering about what his feelings were in regards to Josie and Tiffany. Now that a few days had passed since his initial shock of finding out Josie was now dating his former best friend, as much as he hated to admit it, he didn't mind it as much as it should. On the few brief occasions he had seen them when dropping off Anna or Cindy they looked really happy, and as much as it pained him to admit it, Josie looked happier with Jeremy than she had with him.

And then there was Tiffany, the woman he had kissed. One of his mom's best friends. A married woman. Well, she isn't really married anymore with our gender swap, Michael thought to himself before feeling incredibly guilty for thinking that. I mean she loved her husband, right? It suddenly dawned on Michael that he never really heard Tiffany talk much about her husband. In fact in the last few days she hadn't mentioned him at all. Tiffany even seemed happier the last few days than Michael had ever seen. Michael knew then and there he had to talk to Tiffany about what was going on between them. It may just be anxiety from all the changes in the last week for Michael, but he knew he had to make sure. So he went to his closet and put on a matching baby blue skirt and blouse. He sat down at his makeup counter to make sure his hair was decent, but deciding he really wanted to make some sort of impression to Tiffany, also put on some foundation, lipstick, and mascara. Deciding he was as ready as ever, Michael went downstairs, grabbed the roast, wine, and cookies, and headed over to Tiffany's house.

Michael rang the doorbell but didn't have long as almost immediately Tiffany opened the door. "Oh," Tiffany said, and for the first time since he'd known her Tiffany looked flustered and at a loss for words, "Um please come in. I was hoping I'd get the chance to talk to you."

Michael entered the house as Tiffany led him back to the living room where just a day earlier Michael had woken up on the couch there sleeping against Tiffany. Michael blushed and smiled without realizing it before remembering he was there for a reason. "I didn't know if you'd be up with going out for today's date so I thought I would bring the date to you." Michael felt embarrassed fearing that he was coming off too forward but Tiffany simply said "Thanks. Just put it in the kitchen."

Unsure of how to take Tiffany's fairly curt response, did as she said and came back to the living room where Tiffany had taken her place on the couch where she was surrounded by pillows and seemed to have made camp.

"How bad is it?" Michael asked concerned.

"Not too bad, the doctor's took some x-rays and it turns out all I've got some cracked ribs."

"Why does it look like you're sleeping on the couch?"

"Because I was. Since we swapped I've been sleeping in my former guest room which I guess is my room now, but that bed is as hard as a rock and the couch is so much more comfortable. I'll have to make a note that if we switch back that we replace it with something more comfortable?"

"If?" Michael said noting the use of the word.

"When." Tiffany said quickly, "I mean when. I mean after all, we can't stay like this. You have a girlfriend. I have a husband."

Michael thought about why he came here and took a deep breath before saying something that could change his life forever.
1323311111112121111211112121121111111111.title: Bringing lunch over to Tiffany

1323311111112121111211112121121111111111.content:
It's now or never. Michael thought to himself as he mustered up the nerve to say, "It doesn't have to be that way."

Tiffany looked at Michael from the couch in shock, not sure how to take what he'd said. "What do you mean?"

Trying to broach the subject with kid gloves Michael said, "I'm just saying, the lives we've made for ourselves aren't really that bad. I'd even say they have some...potential benefits that would otherwise be impractical."

"You like being able to wear dresses without getting weird stares from people?" Tiffany says trying to loosen up the tension.

"I think I like you Tiffany." Michael said.

What felt like a small eternity passed Michael decided to clarify a little bit. "I've never felt for someone the way I feel about you. I liked being around Josie, we had a good time. But ever since we started this little experiment, I can't keep my mind of you. I've tried to think about how I'm going to get back to my old life, but when I think about it, it feels just a little empty. When we kissed, it felt so real. So good. I can't imagine feeling that way with someone else. You've added so much enjoyment to my life that I don't want to go on without you being close."

Another dead silence took over the room. Minutes passed without a word said, Michael heard the silence and it felt like a dagger.

"You know what, I'm sorry. I don't know what I was thinking. I'll just get out of hear." And Michael went for the door with tears forming in his eyes.
1323311111112121111211112121121111111111.title: "It doesn't have to be that way."

choices: They decide to go back to their normal genders and deal with the consequences
They decide to keep their current genders and try to adjust
1323311111112121111211112121121111111111.content:
Just before Michael opened the front door he heard a shout of "Wait!" Michael stopped, turned, and said "No, I'm sorry I said that. I don't know what I was thin..."

"IthinkIfeelthesamewayaboutyou" Tiffany blurted out. Both stood in silence, both surprised by what had been revealed to each other. Michael stepped away from the door and sat down in a armchair across from Tiffany on the couch. "Wow." He said letting out the only thought running through his head. "Wow."

"Yeah." Tiffany said sinking down into the couch. This wasn't exactly how Michael had pictured their confessions of shared feelings going. It wasn't like the movies where two people confess their love and share a passionate embrace and kiss that possibly leads somewhere more. Nope, two just people awkwardly sitting across from each other as if it was a middle school dance, waiting for someone to make the first move.

"So," Michael finally said, "we like each other."

Tiffany gave a weak smile, "Looks like we do. Well, what are we going to do about it?"

"What can we do about it?" Michael said trying to put everything in his mind together. "If we are really as serious about this as I think we may be, we have two ways we can go about it and both are going to be tricky." Michael got up to pace and think to try to let off all the energy that was suddenly flowing through his petite frame. "We switch our genders back. I have an ugly break up with Josie, my parents probably disown me for pursuing a relationship with a girl a few years my senior. Although not many years!" Michael quickly backtracked seeing the look on Tiffany's face.

"Not to mention I'll have to go through a messy divorce, which will probably result with me getting nothing. Hell he'll probably try to sue me for emotional damage or some other bullshit. Also if your family takes it as bad as you think they will, then we may not have any place to live and since we are both currently homemakers, no income."

"Or we can keep out current genders." Michael started, "It might not have as many difficulties from a family standpoint. If we understand this universe correctly, you will still be living here still having your ex husband's support, and I will still be in my families good graces." Michael silently added a thought, That is as far as Tiffany is concerned, Anna and mom still know I'm dating my mom's former good friend, either universe I choose that's a conversation I'm not looking forward to.

"But if we go with that choice," Tiffany added continuing the rundown, "We have the awkward situation of living as the opposite gender for as long as we are together. Neither are exactly fun choices. Are you sure you want to go through with this?"

Michael finally stopped pacing and made a hard b-line to the couch, leaned over, and gave Tiffany as strong a kiss as his feminine body could muster.

"Yes."

"Okay. But let's make a decision about how we want to do this before we do anything else."

"Fine." Michael said, a little disappointed, and went back to his pacing. After about two hours of weighing the pros and cons of both sides the two finally came to the decision that would change the rest of their lives.
1323311111112121111211112121121111111111.title: Tiffany cries out "Wait!"

choices: The couple spend the day together
They face their families and friends
1323311111112121111211112121121111111111.content:
“This isn’t going to be easy whichever way we go and I think that after all this talking the one thing we can be sure of is that it’s going to be very complicated no matter what, but … but I like this new me and I think you like this new you …“ said Michael, trailing off expectantly. “Yes, I like this new me also, although right now it’s a little bruised,” replied Tiffany with a pained chuckle.

“Oh, I feel so terrible, you’re hurting because of me, I’m such a terrible person,” Michael cried as he turned from Tiffany. “You are the furthest thing from terrible in my eyes, and I think it’s going to be tough to go down this path, but we’ll make it work,” whispered Tiffany, embracing Michael tenderly. A smile crept into his lips, “Do you think we can do this, Tiffany?” he asked twisting around to look up into Tiffany’s eyes.

“I don’t know where this might all lead, but I’m all in if you are,” said Tiffany, caressing Michael’s cheek lovingly. Michael said nothing, but his eyes told Tiffany all she needed to hear. “Now, you brought me enough food to feed a family, so you better help me eat it all.”

“Eat it all? What? And ruin my girlish figure? No way!” exclaimed Michael in half-mock disgust. He aware that his new frame could not eat nearly as much as his original body, but he was more than happy with it now. Tiffany laughed softly, warry of the pain.
1323311111112121111211112121121111111111.title: They decide to keep their current genders and t...

1323311111112121111211112121121111111111.content:
“Well, just the day before we had our card game I bought a new bikini and I had planned going to the beach today to show it off, but I think right now it might look better on you than on me,” Tiffany said, with a cheeky smile. “Oh, it will Definitely look better on me, “said Michael, pointing at himself, “than on you,” he finished, pointing at Tiffany and posing to show off his figure. The switched up couple cracked up laughing and Tiffany felt glad to be able to lift Michael’s mood.

It took Michael a while to get everything they needed for their day at the beach and find the bikini Tiffany had mentioned. He decided to wear the turquoise, two-piece suit, with a white sarong dress, sandals, a fashionable, floppy hat, silver wrist bangles, a pair of chandelier earrings. Tiffany was completely at a loss for words when Michael came back out with a beach-tote in hand. “Something wrong?” Michael asked, “No, you ... you look amazing. I didn’t expect you to know how to … to … well, look like that,” she replied, “Well, thank you. It’s strange, there are things that simply come to me somehow. It’s hard to explain, but I just know what will go great with what. The moment I saw the bikini I knew what would work with it. It’s strange, but I kinda like it,” Michael said with a smile.

The ride out to the beach was quick, and they managed to get a nice spot. Tiffany made the effort of being the gentleman and carried all their stuff and planted their beach umbrella with a grunt. “Wow, the sun feels amazing, it’s the perfect day for the beach. Great call, Tiff!” Michael enthused, stretching up, closing his eyes, feeling the breeze and taking in the sounds of the beach. When he opened he opened his eyes again, he turned around and caught Tiffany running her eyes up and down his figure. She quickly looked away, but her reddening cheeks made it clear she knew she’d been caught staring.

Michael smiled and said, “Common Tiff, …”
1323311111112121111211112121121111111111.title: The two spend the day at the beach

1323311111112121111211112121121111111112.content:
The rest of the days activities were not nearly as eventful for Michael. After finishing the shopping trip he and Cindy came home to get scolded by Anna who grounded Cindy from her all her credit cards until the planned swap back tomorrow night. Michael even had that ice cream with his mom, they thankfully didn't talk about relationships or anything so heavy, just simple schoolwork and household duties. As soon as it was time, Michael took the keys and headed over to Miranda's house to discuss his dating life for the next week. Not exactly something he was looking forward to.

"You seem to be in much better spirits." Miranda said answering the door.

"I just needed time to sit down and really get a grasp of the situation. I realize it is only a temporary thing and with everything I know about the cards, I'm 100% positive things will go back to normal once I swap everything back." At least, I hope I'm 100% Michael thought letting a splash of doubt in his mind, but he quickly put it off. "I can either sit down in a corner and cry and pout, or I can go out and attempt to have a 'good' time."

"I'm glad you are deciding to make the best of what could have been a dark situation. I'm very proud of you, you have great perspective and I'm proud of you."

"And now that you've buttered me up you're going to set me up with some boy aren't you."

"You know me all too well." Miranda said with a smile. "But before I tell you about him, I just want too make sure that you are ok with this."

"It's not like I'm going to marry the guy or anything, I'm just going to date him to get my family off my back before I get myself back next week."

"Using a guy and throwing him away, wow Michael, you're turning out to be quite a little bitch."

Michael took the joke well but couldn't help but feel a tad bit guilty.

"Ok let me tell you about him, you might even know him. He goes to Josie and Cindy's school. He's my nephew, Dexter."

"PoinDexter is your nephew?!"

"I see you know his nickname." Miranda said, obviously not approving of it.

"I'm sorry, Anna had told me about it." Michael said in a quick lie.

"Well, they've probably told you about who he is a bit of a nerd who has no self confidence. So much so that he's never even asked out a girl out of fear of rejection. But he is such a sweet and gentle boy. It's just so unfortunate my sister has let him just grow up in front of a tv and computer. I swear if he let himself get contacts he'd be so handsome, but he's even afraid of that."

"And you want him to date a real hottie to give him a boost of confidence even though he'll forget that it ever happened in a week."

"I know that, but, I don't know. He won't remember the girl you, but maybe, maybe if he has a fun time with you he'll be able to have some form of confidence in his subconsciousness after the week. I doubt it will work, but I'd like you to at least try for his sake. Plus this isn't all just helping him. It will get your mother off your back to find a boy and get over 'Jeremy', and I know Dexter. He's about as safe a boy for you to be with for a week."

You sat down on a very expensive couch to give yourself some time to think. You knew Dexter from school and Miranda's description of him was giving him too much credit. He was always the most socially awkward, most nervous, most lonely kid in your school. In fact hearing what Miranda said and thinking back to the way you treated him, both through ignoring him and making the occasional perfectly innocent joke with friends made you ashamed of yourself. I swear after this week and I'm back to normal, I really need to rethink the way I think of people, I'm probably a part of the reason Dexter is in such bad shape. The sense of personal shame was really getting to him before being replaced with a strong resolve.

"I'll do it." I will help this guy out. If I have the power to help people, then I need to make sure I do. The cards aren't just for my own personal entertainment. If I think I can help people with them, then by God I will. Taking a deep breath Michael said strongly "I'll go out with Dexter."

"Thank you Michael, you are an amazing man. You know, you're going to make a great father someday. How do we want to set this up? We can either set you up on a blind dinner date, or I can call him over and you can 'spontaneously' meet him and let the magic happen."
1323311111112121111211112121121111111112.title: Meeting with Miranda to learn about a boy

1323311111112121111211112121121111111112.content:
Michael thought about how he should meet Dexter for the first time in his reality. "I don't think that... Simply meeting would be a good idea. I mean, he hasn't much confidence so it would be hard for him to talk to me in a normal situation.", Michael explained to Miranda.

"But wouldn't that also be the case if you two were on a blind date?", she replied. The girlified ex-boy shook his head. "Not quite the same, at least I hope so. Maybe he's more open when we two meet at a restaurant or somewhere else for a blind date. Although it's not bulletproof, I think that would be the best idea.".

Miranda nodded. "As you wish. How about I phone him now?", she suggested. "He'll be at home, probably playing some computer game, so he'll have time. If not, I just phone his mom, she'll make him go.".

"So soon?", asked Michael surprised. "Yeah, why not? The sooner you get to know him... Also tonight is date night, right? So why not?".

Michael nodded but was uneasy with the situation. He knew he had to hurry in order to get his mom off his tail but this was... too soon. Everything was changing quite rapidly for Michael. Yesterday around this time he was still a rather normal boy and in a relationship with Josie. Now he had boobs and was single and was also going to date a guy.

"Okay.", Michael said sighing softly. "Tell him... Tell him to come here in I dunno... Two hours? I have to get dressed. I can't go on a date like this.". Normally Michael would not have cared about how he looked, as long as his clothes looked clean.

"I'll do, just hurry back home. I guess now that you have Tiffany's clothes you have a more fitting dress at home.".

Michael then hurried back hom in order to get dressed. At home he ran into Anna who was quite interested why he had gotten home so early.

"I thought you were over for a girl's night or something?", asked Michael's sister. Under normal conditions he would have said nothing but now that Anna had they're mother's respect and authority he had the urge to tell her.

"I'm just getting dressed.", he explained. "I'm having a blind date with a nephew of Miranda.".

"Is that so? My sister finally tries dating someone.", she said smiling. "And I already thought that you were a lesbian.".

Michael chuckled slightly at Anna's comment. He was indeed a lesbian, he was a boy. "Yeah... I just thought it was time...", he mumbled. "But excuse me... I don't want to get late.". Michael then hurried to his room.

"Calm down...", Michael thought. Anna's comment made him think of what he had lost. "When everything is over you'll get her back... Hopefully.". Michael took a deep breath, his silicon-filled breasts got up slightly. "Okay... Let's get dressed.".

He walked over to his waderobe and looked through it. "This blue cocktail dress will look good on me.". Heather's interests really helped him when it came to things like choosing what to wear.

Michael laid the dress on his bed and then looked for matching shoes. When he found them, he got undressed and got dressed into sexy, lacy, black underwear. He then dressed himself in the dark blue dress and the shoes.

"Okay... Then let's do my make-up.". He sat himself on his vanity table and applied his make-up. Lastly he did his hair. Then he checked himself in the mirror. "Yeah, he'll like me.", Michael giggled.

The "boy" then got back to Miranda's house.
1323311111112121111211112121121111111112.title: Setting up a blind date

1323311111112121111211112121121111111112.content:
Pulling up to Miranda's house, Michael had assumed he's arrived early as he couldn't see Dexter's car anywhere. Although the idea of being first went away after Michael walked up to the door and saw an old fashion bicycle tied to a pillar on the porch with a Pokemon bike chain. Well, I guess I know whose vehicle we're taking Michael thought to himself before ringing the doorbell.

Michael could hear voices approaching, well one voice. He'd could hear Miranda quickly telling Dexter on the other side of the door some what Michael assumed were last minute tips like "be polite" and "don't stare" and "for god's sake talk to her". Hearing the footsteps get closer and closer Michael nervously did a last second examination of himself making sure nothing was showing that he didn't want to show and forced himself to keep a smile on his face.

After what felt like an eternity to both of them, Dexter finally opened the door to see his blind date for the first time and the poor boy didn't know what hit him. Before him was a beautiful creature he had only admired from afar. A real life girl. Michael was kind of embarrassingly pleased to see that Dexter's mouth was literally agape. Although the shock wasn't entirely on one end. Michael was surprised by what was before his eyes as well. Instead of being dressed up for a nice dinner, before him was what one might describe as the living embodiment of the word nerd.

Dexter was not very menacing 5'7" and slightly overweight 175lbs. His face was very blotchy as though he seemed to constantly had an allergy rash of some sort. Atop that blotchy face was a greasy and slicked back black hair which had been slicked back so much in an attempt to look presentable, one could count the individual comb lines, as well as thick nerdy glasses. Dexter wasn't exactly dressed for a first date in a normal person's eyes, but to him this was as good as he'd could dress. He was wearing a pair of worn jeans which was held up with an elastic band in the waistline (pulled up too high of coarse) and a yellow poke-doted black polo shirt. He even had pen and pencil in the shirts pocket.

The couple stood there from a few incredibly long seconds before Michael remembered his role as the sort of guide for Dexter and mustered up his courage and managed to say in his sweet soprano voice "Hi."

Michael got back a meek "Hi" as Dexter nervously moved his eyes around trying not to make eye contact with Michael in any way.

Well Michael thought sighing to himself we're off to a great start
1323311111112121111211112121121111111112.title: Dexter already arrived

1323311111112121111211112121121111111112.content:
After Miranda practically pushed the two off of her front porch, the couple walked in silence to Michael's car. Seemingly wanting to make a good impression, Dexter ran up and opened the passenger seat to the car for Michael.

"Umm are you planning on driving my car?" Michael asked genuinely befuddled at what was going on.

"Oh, right. Of course not." Dexter said shutting the door, but in an attempt to save face ran around to the drivers side and opened the door again so the lady could get in first.

"Thank you," was all Michael could think to say to Dexter. As Dexter got in the passenger seat Michael just sat there thinking to himself, what is he doing? He has no idea how to act. How am I supposed to help him out when he's in such a sorry state right now. Pulling out of the driveway and driving to the restaurant Miranda had booked for the date Michael kept trying to think of some sort of game-plan he could establish to make sure at the end of the date Dexter would be comfortable enough to date again, hell comfortable enough to be social at all, but Michael couldn't come up with anything.

By the time Michael pulled up to the restaurant Michael was beginning to think it was hopeless and was just hoping the date didn't turn into an all out disaster that would scar Dexter for life. As Michael shifted into park Dexter nervously jumped out of the car like a bullet and ran all the way around to the other side and opened the door for Michael for a third time.

"You know, you don't have to do that every single time?" Michael said a tad bit exasperatedly.

"Oh, sorry." Dexter said looking like Michael had just burst his bubble.

It's getting better and better Michael thought mentally slapping himself.

By the time the two had gotten seated in the restaurant, Dexter was completely deflated and Michael was, if possible, more uncomfortable looking than Dexter.

Could this get any worse? Michael thought to himself.
1323311111112121111211112121121111111112.title: Dinner with the couple

choices: Talking about the date with Miranda
Talking about the date with Anna
1323311111112121111211112121121111111112.content:
It had to be the most awkward first date in the long history of first dates. Not a word was exchanged. Neither could look at the other for more than a second before embarrassingly turning away. The two just sat there drinking water and occasionally taking a bite of bread in complete and utter silence.

This is ridiculous! Michael thought getting driven a bit crazy by the silence. I've switched genders, shopped for prom dresses, and found out my girlfriend is dating another boy and I managed to get through it. But THIS is what's going to beat me? Taking a deep breath and going into the depth of his knowledge of things they may have in common and came up with something just crazy enough to work. Time for a hail Mary.

Putting his bread down and looking Dexter dead in the eyes Michael said, "Bulbasaur, Charmander, or Squirtle?"

Dexter did a double take as though stunned his date was talking to him, "Excuse me?"

"Bulbasaur, Charmander, or Squirtle?" Michael asked again thinking more and more this idea was stupid.

Absolutely stunned that a girl was asking him, and not just any girl, a gorgeous girl like Michael, about Pokemon seemed to have sparked something in Dexter. Finally making solid eye contact with Michael, Dexter started talking about the different beneficial and detrimental qualities of each one. For the remainder of the dinner and continuing with desert the two found a common interest in the world of an old game boy game from 15 years ago. Although Michael had lost his interest in things like sports and video games to Heather days before, he still remembered enough about the games to fake it. Michael was proud of what was happening, Dexter wasn't fumbling over his words anymore and had a sparkle in his eyes that Michael knew could earn him a date with a girl, well maybe if Dexter got a makeover. By the time the check came Dexter stopped Michael from paying half, Michael felt really good about what he did here today.

"So Michael." Dexter said with a jump in his step on his way to the car. "I had a great time."

"Me too, you're such a fun guy." Michael said fairly genuinely.

"Hey, I was wondering, would you like to go out tomorrow night? We can go see a movie. I'll pay for the tickets and popcorn." Dexter said excitedly

"Tomorrow?" Michael said remembering he had to play poker with his friends tomorrow to set a few things right, "Sorry, I can't. I already have plans."

"Oh," Dexter said, his spark suddenly snuffed out. "Of-of coarse."

"Oh no no," Michael said quickly, afraid he'd just undone all the good the date had done. "I really do have plans for my family game night, but I'd love to go out with you again Monday or Tuesday."

Dexter said sadly, "You don't have to lie to make me feel better, I know the only reason you went out with me was as a favor to my aunt."

"No I did not!" Michael said panicking a bit considering he had nailed it exactly, "When Miranda told me about you, I made the decision to go out with you. Me. Not Miranda."

"Oh what was it she sold you on, was it the glasses? Was it the pocket protector? I know no girl, especially one looking like you, would go out with me."

"If you keep up all this self pity I sure won't" Michael said deciding to take a more forceful approach. "She told me you were a nice and funny but misunderstood guy who just needed a chance to shine. And tonight you met that description. Although she didn't tell me you were winy, self pitying, selfish snot."

Dexter looked like he'd been slapped.

Michael continued, "Now, I had a good time tonight, and I think you had a good time. I think that merits another date, so you will take me to a movie on Monday night, you will pick the show, and you will pay for the tickets, although I insist on paying for the popcorn and soda, which we will share. Understood?"

Dexter still looked dumbstruck but managed too meekly say, "Ok."

"Good, now let's get into the car and head back to your aunt's. We don't want to worry her."

With that the two of you went back to Miranda's, Michael even let Dexter open the car door for him when they got back, they both walked to the porch and stood there awkwardly one last time before Dexter said, "So, I'll pick you up here on Monday at about 6?"

"Will you have a car by then?" Michael said with a smile.

Dexter, for the first time all night laughed. "Oh yeah, so I guess you'll pick me up here at 6 then?"

"It's a date." Michael said nodding.

"It is, isn't it." Dexter said biking away, smiling wide realizing the for the first time he'd asked a girl out. And she'd said yes.
1323311111112121111211112121121111111112.title: It actually gets better

1323311111112121111211112121121111111112.content:
Michael got into the house. Miranda already stood at the door and was eager to hear how the date went. "You really won't give me any time to come in, will you?", asked Michael looking into Miranda's excited and curious face. She shook her head.

"Okay fine.", Michael sighed and laughed. "Let's sit down, then I tell you everything.". Both went to the kitchen where they took seat at the kitchen table. "So, we both went out. Dexter was very nervous and was kinda...".

"... and then we both arranged a date for monday.", Michael finished quite a while later. He just hoped that Miranda did not ask why the family had a game night.

"It seems you had quite fun.", smiled Miranda. "And it's good to hear that he was getting a bit more confident. I swear, the boy was too afraid to talk to his shadow.". Both laughed. "Yeah, I noticed.", replied Michael. "But he's nice. Let's just hope this new confidence stays when we swap back.".

"Yeah. We have no idea what swapping back will do.", agreed Miranda. "But if it works like I think, then he may not remember going out with you but he'll keep his new found confidence.".

Michael pushed a strand of his long hair behind his ear. "Yeah, it would be a shame if not.".

"After going out with him, I feel kinda bad for how I treated him at school. But this was a different life... I guess mom probably treats him now like I did.", he thought.

"So, how are you enjoying your new life, besides the obvious backdrafts of course?", asked Miranda suddenly. Michael had made quite a sad face while thinking of how he treated Dexter but Miranda thought that it was because Michael thought that Dexter might turn back to who he was before the date. Therefore Miranda tried to change the subject.

"Well...", Michael began. "It's kinda nice, you know? I have a much better relationship with my mother, now that she thinks that she has two daughters. It's also interesting to have Heather's interests. I was really amazed at how much fun I had shopping.".

Miranda smiled. "It's good to hear that not everything's bad. I have to say, I enjoy your muscle tone. Picking things up and everything has gotten much easier. You should worry, maybe I'll keep that.". Again both laughed.

"Oh look at the time.", Michael said surprised when he suddenly looked at the clock while laughing. "I better get home. Anna is not really pleased if I get home too late, even though it's date night.".

Miranda laughed. "Yeah, you're sister really has the pants on, right? Well then, hurry.".

Michael said goodbye to Miranda and drove home.

1323311111112121111211112121121111111112.content:
The next morning meant having to wake up at 6:00 AM in order to get Michael and the rest of the family up and all dressed up. Michael also had the added responsibility of making the nice hearty sausage and bacon filled breakfast for his father and cut up fruit bowl for Himself, Cindy, and Anna. After getting that ready Michael went back to his room and got out of his revealing robe and got dressed in his Sunday best. Although for Michael every other time this had meant a pair of khakis and a shirt with buttons on it. Today Michael knew that he was expected to get dolled up and wear a matching dress with his mother and sister. With Anna in charge the three went wearing some nice flowery purple attires. Michael couldn't help but notice that his dress was by far the shortest and lowest cut. The body hair switch is SO not enough payback for Tiffany for the wardrobe Michael thought to himself blushing catching a glimpse of himself in the mirror.

The service was very nice, although when the preacher started talking about the virtues of sharing, Michael, Cindy, and Anna all let out some audible giggles that got a few nasty stares. The family went on to have a nice lunch at a nice steakhouse where the family had some nice small talk. Michael learned that his father was going out of town for a few days after lunch which was a relief to Michael and the others as it would mean they could get through the swaps tonight without the risk of interruption or unintended interference. About half way through the meal Michael excused himself to use the ladies room.

"I'll join you." Michael's mother said abruptly getting up to join her.

As soon as they entered the restroom (Michael did have to pause for a second to remind himself which bathroom to enter) Cindy checked under the stalls to make sure they were alone before saying, "I just wanted to make sure that you were certain that tonight you were ok with me keeping your friends and school load for now."

"I've thought long and hard about it, and I'm sure mom."

"If it will make things easier on you I'd rally like to trade friends back, I shouldn't have to take so many parts of your life, it's too much."

"No no, I insist. If you're going to go to school, you are going to need friends. School will be ten times harder if you don't have Josie and the others with you." Michael said, not only genuinely meaning what he was saying, but also because he knew if he switched friends back it could cause consequences with his trades with his mother's friends.

"You are the greatest daughter in the world." Cindy said giving Michael a big hug. "I swear after we get through High school I will make sure you get to the best school you can get in, and then we'll start finding you a man."

"Mom, enough guy talk. Besides, I'm dating a boy now. You should worry about finding Anna a boy for now."

"Oh, okay." Cindy said, a spring seemingly lost from her step, "You know, tonight if you want I'm sure we can manipulate things around so that you and Melody or Phillip..."

"MOM! Enough!" Some elderly lady entered the room just in time to hear Michael raise his voice a bit, "Let's drop the subject."

"You're right Michael, consider it dropped."

Cindy was putting together her ensemble for the day, Anna was doing the homework she'd neglected to do all weekend, and was getting out the step stool so he could reach all the ingredients for pancakes. Just your everyday, nice, quiet morning.

After everyone had gotten ready and eaten, Michael dropped the girls off at school and headed home to clean up the kitchen. It took Michael longer to clean up than it usually did the few times his mom made him do it. When he wasn't thinking his breasts would push uncomfortably down onto tables and counters. And he had to reach for the counters because thanks to Heather's height (or lack there of) he was constantly reaching up on his tippy toes and using step ladders and chairs to reach the center of tables and the back of counters and mirrors. Blowing his hair out of his face for what felt like the hundredth time in the last hour Michael suddenly heard the doorbell ring. Michael opened the door to see Tiffany there for their usual jog in a pair of Michael's old shorts and a basketball jersey.

"Don't tell me you forgot about our morning workout again." Tiffany said exasperatedly, "I swear it's as if you didn't want to be the perfect little housewife for Josie. By the way, how has life been for you so far as the fairer sex?"

Michael cringed a little bit at the last part, "Come on in a have a seat. I'll get you a glass of juice and I'll tell you how much 'fun' I've been having."

Tiffany sat in the living room while Michael told her of his interesting weekend. Tiffany was very good as far as the appropriate reactions. She smiled when Michael told her about shopping with mom, was distraught when he told her about Josie and him not dating with him as a girl, and laughed her ass off when Michael got to the date.

"My my, you've had quite a busy weekend, I'm sorry to say that mine hasn't been nearly as eventful. The only thing that's been extremely different for me was getting kissed by my husband and him complaining about my stubble much to my embarrassment."

Michael got in a good laugh at the idea although questioned, "Wait a minute. How come you are still married to your husband if Josie and I aren't together?"

Tiffany shrugged, "I can only guess that it's the ring. Although now that I think about it, outside of a few kisses on the check he hasn't been very affectionate, although I'd just assumed that it had something to do with switching sex lives. How has that worked for you by the way? Notice anything?"

"Can't say that I do, and considering the fact I'm dating boys at the time I must say I'm extremely thankful for that. I guess it has to do with the whole marriage thing I guess. But who knows, maybe if Josie and I were still together it'd still effect us. You know what, I don't want to think about it, I'll go put on some shorts and a sports bra and we'll go for a jog."

"Actually I was thinking of doing something a bit different." Tiffany said slyly.

"What are you up to."

"Well part of being a girl is having a bit of a handicap at certain things."

"I've noticed." Michael said looking down at his current chest.

"I was just thinking that we take advantage of this chance for you and we can try a few different things this week, like maybe some golf, tennis, or even" Tiffany reached down into her gym bag, "some basketball. What do you say? You want to try it, or are you too much of a girly girl to accept?"

Kind of liking the idea of the challenge "You're on. I know I can beat you in basketball, after all I'm carrying two around already" Michael said while cheekily lift up Tiffany's former boobs.

"You are so going down."

And with that Michael got dressed in sports bra, a revealing tank top, and some bike shorts and the two friends left to go to the gym for a game.

The thought of this Michael had to admit in the back of his mind could be an interesting experience once this initial girly week was over with.

132331112.content:
Melody went home happily after playing with what were probably her friends now. At least she guessed they were. “I wonder why Jeremy had to go home and not me…”, she thought. “And Cindy had called him ‘young lady’. We didn’t swap anything, did we?”. She could not come up with a possible solution. The friends had not found out about the two minutes limit so far. “Maybe I should talk to Jeremy about this. Perhaps he found out something while being at home.”.

Melody really enjoyed being outside alone at this time. Her parents would have never allowed it but suddenly it seemed as if everything was fine with that. “I could get used to this.”, she smiled and soon arrived her home.

She entered the house with the key she had in her purse. “I’m home.”, she called out while taking off her shoes. Her mother came out of the kitchen to greet her. “That’s nice.”, she smiled. “Did you have fun?”. Melody nodded.

“Yeah it was real fun. Too bad it’s already over.”, she admitted and went over to the stairs. “Anyway, I’m upstairs.”.

Melody then headed upstairs. Normally she would have chatted with her mother more but right now she was too interested to see if Jeremy had found anything out. Melody was surprised to see her brother sitting on her bed.

“Hey, Jeremy. What are you doing in my room?”, she asked him and received a big sigh from him.

“It’s not your room anymore.”, he explained. “It seems as if I have taken over your life or something. Michael’s dad was treating me like some little girl. The same goes for mom and dad. They think I’m their daughter. At first I couldn’t believe it but then I inspected what should be your room. It looks mostly the same but look closer.”.

Melody did what her brother told her to do and looked around her room. Everything looked normal. There were still the pink walls, her bed with the pink bed sheets and fluffy pillows, also her stuffed animals were where they belonged.

“I can’t see any difference.”, she told her brother while looking at the poster of various boy bands on her wall. Everything was like it was this morning.

“Look closer.”.

Melody continued. She went over to her wardrobe and stopped there. She normally left one door slightly open, so she can access it faster. Now the door was closed. Curious she opened it and was astonished about what she found in there.

Instead of her normal clothes there were now Jeremy’s clothes in there. Except for the school uniform which was still the girl’s uniform of her school.

“You exchanged everything to play a prank on me, didn’t you?”, she asked disbelievingly and looked into her brother’s face. She knew that he did not.

Jeremy shook his head. “No. Sadly I did not. Go over to your desk and look at your homework.”.

Melody went slowly over there. She looked at aforementioned homework and gasped. While the text was still the same, the handwriting had changed. She recognized it as Jeremy’s. Also the name on it had changed to Jeremy’s.

“Unbelievable!”, she gasped. “So, everyone really thinks you’re me. I had suspected it but couldn’t believe it. But how? We hadn’t swapped anything.”.

“I know. I’ve been thinking about it for quite a while.”, he said and stroke absentmindedly across his now smooth feminine legs. “Maybe there really is a catch. I mean, it’s quite strange that the cards allow you to swap but don’t force you. Maybe we have to swap.”.

“But we didn’t.”, replied Melody.

“I know.”, nodded Jeremy. “But remember when I wanted to swap attitude with Anna but nothing had happened? Maybe, just maybe, there is a time limit. I mean why else should nothing had happened. I mean look at our situation right now!”.

Melody nodded. Everything her brother told her made sense. “I guess you’re right. So… Until we can swap back, I’m stuck with being you.”.

“Yeah.”, sighed Jeremy. “And I’m you. At least our first names stayed the same but still. Let’s just hope the following days won’t be too awkward.”.

“That makes me think…”. Melody crossed her arms and cocked her head to one side. “If we HAVE to swap… Anna neglected to swap, right? So what had been swapped then?”.

Jeremy shrugged his shoulders. “No idea. But I guess it was nothing physical and probably had nothing to do with us. I mean if we were in for the swap, we would have noticed by now, right?”.

Melody agreed.

“Jeremy. It’s time for bed!”, called out a familiar voice, the two recognized as their mothers. Jeremy sighed out loud.

“It sucks. Now I have to go to bed soon. My own mom tells me again when I have to go to bed. I mean, I’m 13 years old now and she still tells me when to go to bed.”.

Melody smiled. “It’s not that bad. Also you know how mom is.”.

“Yeah, right.”, he sighed and got up from his girly bed. “Well, I’ll brush my teeth then.”.

Melody left her former room together with her brother and then headed over to what was now her room. She smiled when she looked around. The room did not look as nice as her own but it was bigger.

She looked at the trophies Jeremy had gathered over the course of his life and at the sport posters in his room.

“This will be weird but I think I’ll have fun.”, smiled Melody and threw herself on the bed.

1323311122.content:
Jeremy woke up the next morning by the sound of an alarm clock which did not sound like his own but sounded familiar. At first he was confused why he was lying in a bed with pink bed sheets and why the walls of his room were painted pink but he regained all the memories of last night very quickly.

“Right…”, he mumbled. “I’m my sister now… Something I was really looking forward to…”. He then deactivated the clock and got up.

“At least, I’m still wearing my original clothes.”, he said and rubbed over his pajama pants and felt the smooth, feminine legs beneath it. “Well, you can’t have everything.”.

He then got up from the bed and walked groggily outside the room to the bathroom. On his way there he met Melody who got out of her room just before him. “Morning, s-… brother.”, he said and had to remind himself that everyone would see her as a guy.

Melody smiled at her “sister”. “Morning.”, she said and entered the bathroom first. Normally Jeremy would have gone mad and screamed at her that he was going in first but today he was simply not in the mood. Therefore he leaned against the wall beside the bathroom door and waited.

“I’m not looking forward to going to school as you.”, said Jeremy but Melody could not hear him, she had just entered the shower.

“Well, I guess she’ll enjoy it. I mean after all she gets to keep my friends. School will be very boring if I can’t joke around with Cindy. Oh, well. I’ll endure it.”, he thought.

While he was waiting for Melody to finish, his mother came by. “Morning, honey.”, she smiled at Jeremy. “I hope you slept well.”.

Jeremy nodded but stayed silent. He was not in the mood to talk to his mother right now. Luckily she left and began preparing breakfast.

“You can in.”. Finally Melody came out of the bathroom with a towel wrapped around her body. Jeremy then entered without exchanging any word.

When Jeremy had showered and dried himself, he went down where his mother, father and “brother” were having breakfast.

His father looked up from his newspaper. “Morning, princess.”, he smiled and reminded Jeremy once again that he was still considered a girl.

“Morning…”, replied Jeremy and sat down. The breakfast was luckily quiet. Nobody had to say something. Jeremy did not want to talk about anything right now, would be too awkward to try to pretend to be his parent’s daughter.

“Also, I have to pretend to be Melody all day… Some peace now is very useful.”, he thought and began eating his breakfast.

The silence was broken by his mother when everyone had finished eating. “Okay, kids. Now get up and get dressed or else you’ll be too late for school.”, she smiled.

“Okay, mom.”, replied Melody and Jeremy in unison and went back to their respective rooms. Now was the moment Jeremy had feared since he had inspected the room yesterday.

“Although I got to keep my own clothes, I’m still considered a girl… Which means I have to wear the girl’s uniform of my sister’s school.”, he sighed and got the uniform out of the wardrobe.

First he put on the light blue blouse, and then he put the dark blue pullover over it. This was fairly normal so far. The worst part was still to come. He looked horrified at the pullover matching skirt and slipped it on.

Lastly he put on the white, knee-high socks and the brown shoes. He looked into the mirror and immediately ridiculous. Although he had to admit that his legs looked really good in the skirt.

“Okay. You can do it.”, he thought and got out of his room and ran right into Melody, dressed in his former school uniform. She began laughing heavily.

“Yeah, thanks.”, sighed Jeremy. “This really helps me a lot.”.

“Sorry, bro- er sis.”, she apologized. “You’re just looking so ridiculous.”.

“I know… Anyway, let’s go…”. Both left the house but not before Jeremy got a kiss on his forehead from his mom. He had not received one for years. He was too old for this but not anymore.

“It’s really amazing what 4 years difference can make. Mom treats me like some completely different person.”, said Jeremy when they had left the house.

“Well, you are a different person.”.

Inside, Jeremy noticed one problem right away: He had no idea where Melody’s locker was or what her combination was. “Great. She could have told me… Okay, she probably didn’t think of it, just like me.”.

Jeremy went through the hallways, trying to think of a moment when Melody told him where her locker was but he could not remember one. He looked at the lockers, hoping he would find a trace which would lead to the deduction that this was Melody’s locker.

Unfortunately, all looked the same. No name on it or anything like that.

“Great.”, he thought. “I’m wandering around school, looking for a locker and even if I’d find it, I have no idea what the combination was. Please god, send someone to help me!”.

The girl smiled warmly at Jeremy. She had wavy brown hair which framed her face rather nicely. She was wearing the same uniform Jeremy was currently wearing. She had her hands behind her back and bowed slightly forward when she did not get any answer from who she thought was her friend Melody.

“Everything’s alright, Melody? Did Greg break up with you or why are you spaced out right now?”, asked the girl, her face had changed from a warm smile to a worried and confused face.

“Greg?”, thought Jeremy confused. “Who’s Greg? Does Melody have a boyfriend? Can’t be, she would have bragged about this.”.

Jeremy looked at the girl and tried to answer something before she thought he was brain dead.

“Er… No. No. Everything’s alright. I’m just… er… sleepy.”, he stuttered and hoped she would believe him. Jeremy never was good at lying or acting in that matter. Today and tomorrow would be a real challenge for him.

The girl looked at him, raising an eyebrow. Jeremy’s heart beat faster. “She looked through it.”, he thought. “She know I’m just a boy in a girl’s uniform. She simply has to know. It’s so obvious.”. But then the girl’s face returned to a smile.

“I see.”, she smiled at him. “I guess you’ve been thinking about Greg all night.”. Again. Who was this Greg? Jeremy had never met some Greg before. “Er… yeah. That’s why I’m sleepy… And a bit jazzed. I… er… have forgotten where my locker is. Silly me, I know. I guess you can’t show me where it is?”.

The girl suddenly laughed. “Oh man, you really are in love. Your brain can’t have any other thought than Greg, huh? Come on, girl. I’ll show you.”.

Jeremy, still wondering who the girl was talking about, followed her. At least this one problem was solved, he could get to “his” locker. Maybe she knew the combination and he could get her to tell him that. Jeremy felt like he could do it. “She didn’t notice. Let’s hope I can keep up this act.”.

The two arrived at the locker. “Erm… I kinda have forgotten my… combination.”, he said embarrassed. The girl shook her head. “Love really makes you stupid. It’s 7, 25. The day you got together with Greg, remember?”.

Inside he saw some books and on the locker door was a photo which showed Jeremy in the girl’s uniform and some guy he had never met before in his life. “I suppose this is Greg.”, he thought. Luckily there was also a timetable. “Good. I don’t have to ask her what subjects I have.”.

Jeremy looked at it and saw that he had maths as the first lesson. Jeremy never was good at maths but he was sure that what they went through in Melody’s class would a piece of cake for him.

“Well, I’ll see you at lunch.”, smiled the girl and went away. “Thanks for helping the silly me.”, replied Jeremy.

“You’re welcome.”.

Jeremy was relieved that he was alone now. Although she helped him, it was easier being Melody when nobody was around. He did not had to act.

"There there, it's going to be all right." Philipp said wrapping an arm around Anna's waist which Anna slapped away, "Back off Philipp, doesn't matter who's body I'm in or what gender you're into, I don't want you hitting on me."

"You're loss." Philipp said shrugging the rejection off.

"Okay, now that we've all cooled off, let's play the next hand." Josie said dealing out the cards.
1553212.title: This Time Jeremy Wins

15532121.content:
"Great! I win and I know exactly what I want." Philipp said excitedly with a grin on his face that made everyone playing a little nervous. "It won't exactly be like I'd hoped it would be, but I can still get what I want. I want to swap relationship status regarding Josie with Michael." Philipp said happily.

Josie was mortified, she didn't want to have Philipp for a boyfriend, even for a week. She closed her eyes getting ready for the worst as she anticipated some sort of mental change that would make her fall head over heels for Philipp, but as she opened her eyes and looked at Philipp she felt the same disgust she'd always felt. "Good, I don't think it worked."

"What do you mean? I did the switching thing in time." Philipp said suddenly looking bummed out.

"Maybe the cards won't swap something that trivial." Anna said. Josie turned to her and said with anger, "Our relationship is not trivial!"

"Correct, it wasn't trivial." Said Michael looking at his smartphone, "We aren't seeing each other anymore, you and Philipp are facebook official." He said as he showed the group the relationship status that had Michael single and Josie and Philipp in a relationship.

"Yes!" Philipp said victorious as Josie looked crest fallen. She grabbed the phone and started looking through some pictures. "Well, atleast I don't look happy. But this one will be easily fixed, I'll just 'break up' with Philipp and start seeing Michael again."

Anna suddenly stepped in, "No no no. What happened to 'following the card's rules,' and 'this is all just fun'? Not so fun when something not fun happens to you."

"That's different, this is something that can be changed easily." Josie said meekishly.

"Fine, do that. Cheat the game, but I bet these magic cards wouldn't like it. For all we know you might have something bad happen to you if you don't just suck it up and go through with it."

"Yeah!" Philipp added punctuating the point.

Jeremy suddenly spoke up for the first time in a while and quietly said, "These cards are fun, but serious business. You should just do what they say."

"Come on Josie, it won't be that bad," Michael said comforting his now former girlfriend, but as she was becoming comforted he took it one sentence too far, "Besides, it could be fun."

"Fun?" Josie said as if she couldn't believe Michael had just said that, "You know this is Philipp we're talking about right?"

"Hey!"

"I'm just saying it's not the end of the world." Michael said backtracking, "And if I could take the bullet for you I would, but the way that swap was worded I don't think I can help you out."

Suddenly Anna got a downright devious idea, "But you could suffer with her!"

"What do you mean?" Michael said a little afraid of what his sister's devious mind had come up with.

"I mean, that since it's just a week of hell for Josie, you should also suffer a little. I say that since you're basically a girl right now, you should go out with a guy this week." Anna said smuggly, "And kiss him."

"Uh, no. Don't have to so I won't." Michael said ready to laugh, but Anna wasn't joking. "I mean it, you should go out with a guy this week. Are you afraid?"

"No, really I just don't want to go out with a guy, nothing complex about it."

"You won't even do it for Josie as a show that you'll go through hell if she has to."

"I guess I would, but Josie doesn't want me to, right Josie?"

But rather than the enthusiastic 'right honey!' Michael had hoped for, Josie said, "Well, you wouldn't have to."

"Josie?"

"Look, it'll be a dumb little thing we can laugh about a few weeks from now. We're playing with the cards for different experiences, even if the experience may suck." Josie gave a look to Philipp with that last line.

"Come on Michael, how about I also do your chores for 2 weeks if you do it." It'd be more than worth it to see the uncomfortable look on his face. Anna thought to herself.

"I don't know..." Michael said, he certainly wasn't keen on the idea of going out with a dude.

"If you do this with me then I'll..." Josie said as she leaned in and whispered something into Michael's ear that only he could hear. Michael's eyes opened up wide and said, "You've got a deal!"

"Good." Anna said with an evil look on Jeremy's face.

"Enough with your stupid deals and stuff, I want to play." Melody said taking and dealing the cards.
15532121.title: Philipp wins and get's a boy toy

info.brief_description: Six friends find a deck of poker cards which changes their lives.
info.description:
500 GPs for every good chapter added.

This story is inspired by a story from Fiction Branches: http://transform.to/~zach/cgi-bin/fbstorypage.pl?page=110302024226jedilord&path=...

Michael finds a magical deck of poker cards which has a completely different bet than money.

Main Characters:

-Michael Ferguson, 17 years old, it's his birthday, he finds the deck of cards. 6", blond, short hair. Average guy.

-Anna Ferguson, 15 years old, Michael's sister. Attends to her brother's birthday but would rather be at the mall with her friends. 5"4', C-Cups, long blond hair. Dresses provocatively.

-Jeremy Parker, 16 years old. Michael's best friend. Knows Michael since elementary school. 6"4', curly brown hair.

-Josie Mason, 17 years old. Michael's girlfriend. Is older than Michael. 5"6', D-Cups, shoulder length red hair, dresses conservative.

-Philipp Jenkins, 16 years old. Knows Michael and Jeremy since High School. He is some kind of pervert. 5"10', black hair, wears glasses.

-Melody Parker, 13 years old. Jeremy's little sister. No friend of Michael in the common sense. Invited herself to the party. 5". A- Cups, Long brown hair, usually in a pigtail.

The Deck of Cards:

The participants play a normal poker hand but without betting. The one who wins the hand can swap anything he wants from the other players simply by saying the words "I want to swap ... with ... ". What you swap can be anything but it is not allowed to swap everything at once. For example you can swap heads with someone but you cannot swap the whole body in one hand.
When a swap took place nobody except the ones playing at the moment will notice anything strange, reality will alter so that it was always that way.
The words for a swap have to be spoken within a time frame of two minutes. If not, a random swap between the winner and one of the losers takes place.
A swap which took place cannot be reverted by the person's who participated in the swap within 48 hours. For example if Michael swaps hair with Anna neither Michale nor Anna can swap their rightful hair back before 48 hours have passed but it is possible for someone other to swap hair with the two of them.
It is also not possible to swap something back you had before within 48 hours. For example: Michael now has Anna's hair, Anna has Michael's. Josie wins the hand and swaps hair with Michael so she gets Anna's hair. Michael now has Josie's hair. It would be possible for Anna to swap hair with Michael so she would get Josie's hair but it is not possible for her to swap hair with Josie in order to get her own hair back.
Clothes adjust when someone swaps clothing or if some other physical aspect is swapped which would not fit with the clothes currently worn. For example if someone swaps height with some his clothes adjust to his sight so they fit just like the clothes before fit.
The swaps are not limited to physical appearance. It is possible to swap lives or personal information. If someone decides to swap lives he exchanges places with the person he swaps but keeps his body, clothes and first name. Family, friends and gender get swapped. It is possible as well to swap tastes, personality, connections to persons (e.g. Michael could swap being the son of Jeremy's mother. He would still live his own life, in his own house with his parents and sisters but he would be the son of Jeremy's mother).
If someone quits playing the game while the others continue, the person will only notice the swaps prior quitting the game. Every swap which takes place afterwards will be completely unnoticed by the person. Also it is impossible to tell someone who not participated what has been swapped, because every information regarding a swap cannot be heard by someone who did not participate. For example: Michael tells his mother that he swapped hair with his sister. For Michaels mother he will have not said anything. Not even his lips moved.

New Addition: (thanks to Jason for the idea)

In the box Michael found are 4 cards hidden. 4 Joker cards. If used those for the game a special rule applies. If someone wins with one of them as his hand, he can choose what to swap between other people. (e.g. Michael wins with at least one Joker on his hand. He then can swap "I want that Josie and Jeremy chests with each other").
Please only use these cards when they are discovered within the path and don't let them win with these cards that often

You can add more characters if you wish but don't create millions of siblings.
Don't suddenly end the story
Don't create chapters with just the two options (e.g. Does he swap something with her?)
At least five sentences per chapter.
Minimum of 6 swaps and a maximum of 15 per poker evening.
No killing
Explore how the characters life is with the swap instead of just jumping from one evening of playing poker to an other.
Have Fun.
